creator: evrim@envy.com.tr
text:
While i was surfing the net, i was trying to enter the site packetfactory.net
but i have written accidentally www.packetfactory.net./ ( a dot at the end) and
it did not show me the real page but it did show me the www.leviathan.org.Their
IP's are same so they are virtual hosts. On that box,  probably, leviathan.org
is the master site and packetfactory is the secondary virtual host. I did the
same thing with 1.3.20 but it handled correctly. I'm not sure this bug exists on
any other 2.0.32 or versions before.

Thnx.
evrim

i don't have enough time & resources to improve this bug report. im sure people
at apache.org have a 2.0.32 or 2.0.x box running virtuals hosts on it to test
this bug if they are interested in of course.
creator: evrim@envy.com.tr

text:
I didn't mean you should "improve the summary".  I was just noting that I
had improved it.
creator: slive@apache.org
jwoolley@apache.org
text:
I can't reproduce this on our machines here under 2.0.35+.  If you can't 
reproduce this with a newer version of Apache, can you please close this PR? 
 
Thanks for using Apache!

creator: jwoolley@apache.org
text: No response from submitter, and it worked for me, so assuming fixed.
